meanings.definition: A unit of force equal to 1000 dynes.
meanings.sent1: He measured the weight using kines.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the force in kines.
meanings.sent3: The kines in the experiment made the scale go crazy!
meanings.sent4: The kines of determination pushed him forward.
meanings.sent5: The kines of the object was too heavy to lift.

meanings.definition: A combining form meaning “movement,” “motion,” used in the formation of compound words.
meanings.sent1: The dance class focused on different kines.
meanings.sent2: She studied the kines of the body in anatomy class.
meanings.sent3: The kines of the clock's hands amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the kines of a powerful orator.
meanings.sent5: The kines of the waves crashing on the shore were mesmerizing.
